summary: This is an email exchange from August 13, 2019, regarding efforts to obtain records from Jeffrey Epstein's prior incarceration in Florida. A Supervisory Staff Attorney from the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center is requesting contact information and documentation from the prior facility or the U.S. Attorney's Office in Florida, noting that the prosecution team has been 'walled off' from the investigation.

persons.name: Supervisory Staff Attorney CLC
persons.role: Supervisory Staff Attorney at New York Metropolitan Correctional Center
persons.context: The sender of the email, requesting access to Jeffrey Epstein's prior incarceration records from Florida and noting the prosecution team has been walled off from the investigation.

events.title: Email request for Epstein's prior incarceration records
events.description: A Supervisory Staff Attorney from the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center emails to request contact information and documentation regarding Jeffrey Epstein's prior incarceration in Florida, referencing investigations into the 'incident this past weekend' (likely Epstein's death).

locations: Palm Beach County Sheriffs Office Violent Crimes Division / Homicide
keyFacts: The email is dated August 13, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
The prosecution team had been 'walled off' from the investigation into Epstein, indicating separation of duties or potential conflicts.
A Supervisory Staff Attorney at the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center was seeking records from Epstein's prior incarceration in Florida.
The email references 'the incident this past weekend,' which is Epstein's death in the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
The only contact provided was the Palm Beach County Sheriff's Office Violent Crimes Division/Homicide.
